website_summaries.verdict: This heavy duty ratcheting screwdriver gives you options with both Phillips and slotted  screwdriver bits. And its magnetic shank works with the 1/4-inch hex shank bits you already have in your garage.
cons: Ratchet slips from time to time

customer_reviews.title: Apparently identical to Snap-On mechanism
customer_reviews.text: I'm really confused by the few negative reviews on this screwdriver. I own the Snap-On extended length ratcheting screwdriver and when I compared this one to the Snap-On the mechanism seems to be identical. Specifically: - Both turn smoothly with a very pleasing feel - Both have 26 ratchet steps per revolution - Both have 2 pawls (that I could feel) - Both have similar deflection when loaded off-axis It is true that the shaft of the Williams driver is not knurled, but that seems a minor benefit for about twice the cost. In sum, this is a great alternative to the Snap-on if you are not interested in paying simply for the name.
customer_reviews.author: A. Block

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and shape, great build quality, ratchet slips occasionally
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality, the size is just right, the stainless steel shank is a thing of beauty and has minimal play, and the ratchet mechanism is smooth and quiet (you can tell right away that this is not your hardware store $10 screwdriver). Included bits are excellent (though lack a square one). However, the ratchet does slip occasionally and the torque ratings are not published - something I find unacceptable in a $40 driver. The handle, while fairly ergonomic, lacks proper grip. The bit-holding magnet is not particularly strong.
customer_reviews.author: K F

customer_reviews.title: Awesome full length and T-handle ratcheting screwdrivers
customer_reviews.text: I have the Williams full length ratcheting screwdriver as well.. and I liked it so much I bought the T-handle one soon after. Don't let the lower tooth count fool you. Compared to other brands like the Bahco ratcheting driver (which I also bought and soon returned) it has a much smoother and in my opinion better ratcheting feel... even though the Bahco has a higher tooth count. The small gap between the shaft and handle doesn't bother me. Only thing I'd suggest would be to put some skateboard tape or the like on the shaft to be able to use with your off hand (see pic). Little expensive, but it's made in the USA and it's a quality product!
customer_reviews.author: My Amazon Reviews

customer_reviews.title: this is the real deal
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a ratcheting magnetic screwdriver that actually holds the screw onto the bit! The last one I bought online could only hold the bit to the screwdriver, but wouldn't actually hold the screw itself. What good is that? I thought the point was that you won't drop screws. Anyway, this one works, really well. Strong magnetic force holds the screw to the bit, not just the bit to the screwdriver. Feels exactly like my old Snap-on that finally broke after 40 years. I guess you'll all have to wait 40 years to see if this one lasts as long as that one, but so far it feels the same.
customer_reviews.author: Marco B.

customer_reviews.title: Snap-on ratcheting screwdriver for less
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit of a snap-on devotee and love their regular ratcheting screwdriver. I was thumbing through the brownells catalog and saw that their magna-tip set was sold with a t-handle driver, which was obviously a williams/snapon rebrand. The snapon version is only black if you get the long shank. Red and orange are the current offerings. SSDMRT4 is $63 off the truck. The brownells rebrand is $35 ( pn WRST4 ), not surprisingly this williams has the exact same part number for almost the same price. So if you want a cheaper snapon ratcheting driver and like blue - get the brownells, if like me you like everything black hard handle, get the williams.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua H. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Built my PC using just this little dude.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfect for assembling PCs, which is what I bought it for. The magnetic tip does not interfere with any components (granted, I didn't wave it all around the circuitry and next to my hard drives to test it but I wouldn't recommend that anyway), and there were a few times where I absentmindedly placed it next to a component pretty closely and nothing went wrong. The extra tips that it comes with are perfect but quite frankly I haven't had to use any others, even for smaller(-ish) screws.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, helped tremendously with maintenance on computers or anything that you'd want a magnetized ratcheting screwdriver for. Keeps me from dropping the screws over and over. The only thing I would make an improvement on is that it needs a bit more of a grip on the handle so it's not so slick sided, and also make the threading on the cap easier to screw back onto the screwdriver where you secure your bits. Otherwise it's fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: T'Laine

customer_reviews.title: Great American Craftsmanship and Value
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations and came quicker than anticipated. Item has a nice heft, fairly well balanced, firm detente that won’t slip from locked, reverse or forward. Fine ratchet with a nice click. Feels like a quality device. Machining on shaft is first rate. Magnet to hold bits seems like it should be just a little stronger, but is adequate. Great value for money given it’s a snap on clone. Won’t be my last Williams item! USA made, bits too. First class!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie H.

customer_reviews.title: Not just a Screwdriver, very durable.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on September 14, 2017 and use it regularly to work on PCs and Phones. I expect that I will misplace this before it breaks, but will buy it again if that should happen. I have suggested buying it to friends that have barrowed it... to keep it from going missing ;)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Murphy

customer_reviews.title: The Best Screwdriver you will ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have the original SnapOn for over 25 years and has never failed me, so I want to try this one a try since is a knockoff, well Im glad I did, I put it thru some projects the first day I got it and if it wasnt for the different grip you will not noticed any different from the original....Great Product...Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Riezgo

customer_reviews.title: IF I COULD RETURN IT NOW I WOULD  -  DOES NOT LAST - CAP FLYS OFF CONSTANTLY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I hate this screw driver and have thrown it in the stupid stuff pile. The screw cap should have a lanyard that does not allow it to fall off. I have had to pick it up dozens of times. The ratchet mechanism is sloppy. My mistake was not sending it back. This is for novices, not professionals. Way too expensive for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: JB Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful. Honestly, put away all the other ratcheting drivers. This one is on a whole different level than the Kleins/weras/rolgear/others. My only gripe? The bit holding compartment seems like an afterthought. It's just an open compartment: nothing to keep the bits from rattling around. Slightly irritating, considering how spectacular the rest of the driver is.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lindley

customer_reviews.title: Best All Purpose Screwdriver for a PC Technician
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the product for a year now in my professional career on a daily basis, I've used primarily with Desktops, but have found uses in laptops as well. Has great magnetic bits, that have not lost it's magnetism since I've got it. Very sturdy, and the rotary aspect of the driver is top notch, I'm very efficient with this drive, and is continuing to serve me well. Yeah it's a bit pricey, but if I don't have reliable tools, then I'm not an effective technician. 5 stars, nothing but great tings to say about this product. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: PC-Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome screwdriver. Same thing as Snap On
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome screwdriver. Same thing as Snap On. The only thing I don't like is the bits rattle around inside the handle. Not a big deal, but the Husky ratcheting screwdriver I have has a cylinder type holder, almost like a revolver on a gun, that keeps all the bits in place. Unfortunately the Husky holder does not fit in this handle. Still a nice tool.
customer_reviews.author: G D.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This tool is the same as my Snap on - maybe better. The bits it came with are identical and magnetic and fit into the handle. The cap screws on to store bits safely. The ratcheting mechanism is smoother than the one on my orange Snap-on tool. I recommend and would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I wanted another Snap-On screwdriver, but at the time of purchase, I couldn't justify the cost. Well this screwdriver is made by THE company that makes them for Snap-On. You get the quality and function, just not the color selection. supplied bits are high quality, made in the USA as well.
customer_reviews.author: networkguy

customer_reviews.title: Almost the perfect screwdriver!
customer_reviews.text: One of my all time favorite screwdrivers. It has the same internals and basically the same bits as the more expensive snap-on ratchet screwdriver (same quality just one of the bits is exchanged for a different bit style). The only downsides is that unlike the snap-on screwdriver is that the shaft does not have knurling. At first I thought this wouldn't be that big of a turn off but was quickly reminded of how useful the extra grip can be. After passing it off to a machinist and having knurls put in it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B.

customer_reviews.title: Get a Wiha Ultra Driver instead.
customer_reviews.text: Handle and direction switch made of cheap feeling plastic. Bits stored loosely in handle hollow rattle with the slightest of movement. The ratchet movement is nothing to write home about Couldn’t believe I paid 35 bucks for this when for 10 dollars less I could have gotten a sleek Wiha Ultra driver.
customer_reviews.author: isle of Lucy

customer_reviews.title: This is a high quality tool
customer_reviews.text: I owned this EXACT tool several years ago... except it said snap on the handle and was red...Seriously, this must be coming off the same factory line as snap on, there is no difference whatsoever.. High quality tool, period.
customer_reviews.author: schmidt911

customer_reviews.title: Did not work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I got the screwdrivers which appear to be excellent quality and I figured I would I would get their ratcheting screwdriver. It felt like great quality but it was jammed and won't work. I'm sure its a good product just got a defect so I will look for another brand
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: 1st Rate Compact T-Handle
customer_reviews.text: This is well built and rock-solid. The ratcheting mechanism feels precise and more "fine tooth" than I expected. The t handle is small, but it "palms" in your hand very well. The shaft is solid metal and feels durable. I do wish this would have been offered in a more complete set, with extra screwdriver and nut driver bits, as well as a case to hold it all. This is a personal preference and in no way takes takes away from the fine tool that this t handle driver is.. I highly recommend it. GJM
customer_reviews.author: Older than Old

customer_reviews.title: Great Ratchet! Gets the job done, every time!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ratcheting screwdriver. With the bits at the head of it, magnetic connection and ratchet ability, it's goes and does what you need it to do everytime. My father had a SNAP ON one and has now had it for 25 years and it's still as good as new so I had to have one of my own. This was a nicely priced item, and reviews were good so I purchased it. It's a fantastic product and I have owned it for several months now. LOVE IT, GET IT!
customer_reviews.author: Autobadges

customer_reviews.title: Sluggish ratcheting mechanism
customer_reviews.text: The ratcheting mechanism feels too sluggish. It's not smooth when ratcheting. Also, the shank is smooth, there's no grip on it so that you can hold and ratchet with your fingers to get a screw started in tight areas.
customer_reviews.author: Fantom.XR7

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It fits comfortably in my hand, the ratcheting is fantastic, the included bits are very well made, and the magnet holds the bits very solidly. I'm sad that I wasted 31 years using other screwdrivers. Update - four years later, still perfect. One slotted bit broke, my fault. To maintain it, I oiled the whole thing, including the plastic. This has kept the piece on the bottom from cross-threading or catching, everything moves quickly and smoothly, and the body of the screwdriver is protected from deterioration.

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the Snap-On counterpart
customer_reviews.text: I have the Orange Snap-On version of this. They are almost identical in build and quality. Best part is that this one is half the price of the Snap-On one. Really like that the that the bits become magnetic when you put them in the bit. This has come in handy when I was building a computer and working on my car. Last thing I want is a screw to fall and not hear it hit the ground or cannot find it in the PC. Highly recommended. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse M

customer_reviews.title: Snap On industrial version - same quality we all love!
customer_reviews.text: Made in USA! Dont support the Peral Harbor attacks / communism by buying overseas garbage. Damn near just like the Snap On version. Bought this for my at home tool bag!
customer_reviews.author: T money

customer_reviews.title: really well made
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but very well made. I end up using my Klein ratcheting screwdriver more often, because it holds many bits, so it's more convenient for my purposes, but this things is made SUPER well. It will turn and ratchet even when driving a super loose screw.
customer_reviews.author: an.honest.review

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again, nice!
customer_reviews.text: It is way better than the $10 to $15 big box store junk and less expensive than snap on. I’ve been using it for a month now with zero issues or problems. Feels good in the hand works as a quality tool should.
customer_reviews.author: gary d

customer_reviews.title: Snap on at 1/2 price
customer_reviews.text: Snap on driver at half price. This is excellent for hose clamps and light duty screwdriver jobs that need a little more oomph. Great driver, I recommend THIS one for the long shank.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: When you need to apply that extra torque where a typical ratcheting screwdriver will not work these are the tools you need. On the Snap-On truck (on which I have never bought anything larger than a inspection mirror because of the prices) these will run you over $65. Granted they are not Snap-On brand but I have compared them to the Snap-On brand in my fellow mechanics toolboxes and I do not see the difference other than some gnurling on the shaft of the driver.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Super Smooth and USA Made
customer_reviews.text: As the title says. Came with few tips. One of them - T15 was Snap-On labeled. I have a few other ratcheting screwdrivers, and aside from Japanese ones these are the queens of smooth
customer_reviews.author: Random Y

customer_reviews.title: If you are considering a small ratchet drive screwdriver- Get this one.
customer_reviews.text: Torque and smooth action in a nifty little package. I use this driver primarily for bike maintenance and appreciate its versatility. A available variety of hex drive bits offers many applications. The Williams ratchet action (identical to the higher priced Snap-On) is second to none, precise and strong.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Gets daily use at work
customer_reviews.text: This is a good unit that gets daily use at work where I service door locks. I like the stainless steel feature, because I live in the tropics and rust is a constant battle. The bits are easy to lose, so I have a few extra loaded up. It's a precision tool, so don't pound on the tail end of it. Although it's tempting as it seems pretty tough.
customer_reviews.author: William Walters

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and comfortable in my hand
customer_reviews.text: I have had a couple ratcheting drivers, this one is my go to now. The ratcheting action feels quality and the driver itself feels good in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Josh K

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: If you only have to buy one ratcheting screwdriver in your life, this is the one to get. Unfortunately, you are going to pay a pretty penny for it, and the price has already increased $3 since I bought mine. Maybe it costs more because they are tacking in the shipping? At any rate, the screwdriver is top-notch. You can switch it from forward to reverse using the wheel near the shaft, easy enough for one hand. In-handle storage can hold more bits than the ones supplied. So bottom line is get it when it's on sale, under $30. Don't lend it out and keep it in a safe place.
customer_reviews.author: Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Simply Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: After using this for the first time the feel of the tool is something I had experienced before...top notch quality in a tool that is typically a joke. It feels just like my father's trusty old snap-on ratcheting screwdriver that I could never convince him to give up. I understand why now. No non-sense. Pure greatness. Pros: Nice ratcheting feel Stainless steel shaft A normal amount of tips (not a insane amount of cheap chinese tips that don't even fit in the compartment) Good tips Ergonomics (simple but wow every other screwdriver gets it wrong) Cons: Reinforces the belief that you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: Closest thing to a Snap On that I've used...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic driver for the money. Has the exact same feel as a Snap On (though it's a tad bit louder) with small teeth. The screw on top is much better than a traditional pop on top. The grip is plastic and is comfortable enough. Overall, you can't beat this quality for the money, it's the closest thing to a Snap On that I've seen yet. It's a fantastic deal for wrench-turners and is reliable and effecient, and it's affordable enough for those who just need a ratcheting screwdriver around the house. This is the 2nd tool I've bought that was Williams, both have been awesome tools and were a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Solid well made tool
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable grip, let’s the user really get some good down pressure with enough torque to turn the screw head. Made in USA, so it’s “expensive”, but I think it’s well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: random guy on the internet

customer_reviews.title: Snap Om Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Could not tell the difference against my Snap On 2", only that this one doesn't have the knurled area along the shaft, which is no big deal. Plus, it's made in the U.S.A.!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Iko the dog

customer_reviews.title: Great screwdrivers.
customer_reviews.text: I love the ratcheting screwdrivers, easy on my wrists than other standard drivers. Money well spent. I highly recommend these tools.
customer_reviews.author: David King

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Screwdriver!
customer_reviews.text: I used to have the Snap-On version of this screwdriver and in my opinion they are pretty much identical. I owned this one for about a month and sadly have already lost it but will be reordering this same exact one as I liked it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Professional tool at a fraction of tool truck price.
customer_reviews.text: Most used screwdriver in my tool box. Same as Snap On.
customer_reviews.author: Mike the car guy

customer_reviews.title: My favorite screwdriver.
customer_reviews.text: Bought several years ago. Use it ALL the time. Even the original tips are holding up well. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug K.

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a ratcheting screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: I have been an avid user of the Snap-On brand ratcheting screwdrivers for the last 20 years. I compared this screwdriver with my many snap-on branded ones and the only differences are the shape of the handle and the rough portion of the middle of the metal portion of the screwdriver. The movement and ratcheting are identical. Each complete revolution produces 26 clicks on both screwdrivers. My co-workers just ordered a few themselves after I got this one. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a ratcheting screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sun

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Nothing more than a typical multi-bit screwdriver. Way overpriced for what you get. All the bits are stored loosely in the handle.
customer_reviews.author: TonyVoodoo

customer_reviews.title: Great Screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband and at first I thought a $35 screwdriver you kidding me. It’s what he wanted to I bought it. Now I am in love with this screwdriver. It’s the only one I use and I’m thinking of getting a few for gifts. I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: A Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as good as the 3 other Snap-On ratcheting screwdrivers I own, but very close. My Snap-Ons have a knurled section on the shaft which helps spin the shaft when starting screws, and the shape of the handle is a little different, but the ratcheting mechanism feels the same. The 5 interchangeable bits are actually Snap-on branded with correct part numbers, so they can be replaced by your dealer when they wear out. The phillips tips are the better ACR tips that have ridges to keep them from slipping when you apply torque. This is a very good deal on a high-quality screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Sadtoaster

customer_reviews.title: Feels just like my “Snap On”
customer_reviews.text: Had my snap on for 20 years and lost it at work, in the casino I work at. I’ve seen comparisons on youtube of Wms Vs Snap On. This feels the same.....we shall see :)
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rachet Driver
customer_reviews.text: This little tool is a perfect addition to any tool box. light, compact, smooth action. Great value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: JeffR

customer_reviews.title: Great for tight places
customer_reviews.text: I just used this tool to dismantle the dashboard of my Honda in order to change the cabin filters. Many screws in tight spots where ordinary drivers don't work. This was awesome and provides enough torque to loosen really cranked-down screws. I can tell already this will be one of my favorite tools. The feel and action are quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: In my line of work, I need a magnetic screwdriver with some power. Bought several other brands but they wouldn't even pick up a staple. This is strong, and very easy to use. 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A.Haas

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking around at ratcheting screwdrivers for a long time. I just wanted something simple, but decent quality. I started out wanting a Snap-On version that looks very similar to this. However, it was literally twice the price. While there are slight differences between this one and the Snap-On version, I don't think its enough to justify double the price tag. I don't know how durable it is going to be, but so for it has performed flawlessly and exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Parser

customer_reviews.title: Great altetnative to the $60 Snap-On screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to the well known Snap On ratcheting screwdriver. This is built by the Snap-On OEM so the ratcheting system is just as durable and smooth. The handle has a cap that unacrews for the extra tips, much nicer in my opinion to the Snap-On version which has popped off on me accidentally. The included bits are all very high quality and the same as you would get with the Snap-On driver.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.  Just buy at least one
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Made in USA. Looks to be the exact same as my Snap on and very similar to my Craftsman. Buying another one. Gave this one to my 11 y.o. son so he quits taking mine
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Lee Soon

customer_reviews.title: Good driver
customer_reviews.text: I like the ergonomics about this driver. It's very comfortable and efficient. I have a snapon ratcheting screwdriver and this is very similar. It's got a more matte finish and the ratcheting part is not as "snappy" as a real snapon but it's so close to the real thing you can't go wrong with this. I wish they made a 1/4" drive socket driver just like this but I just use an adapter works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Candelaria

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Very handy tool. The wrist motion with these is a lot easier than a normal screw driver. Uses the standard bit driver hex so slip the screw driver bit out, slip in a small hex driver and it's a ratcheting nut driver.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: A quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well-designed tool. Why did I wait so long to get a ratcheting screw driver? One reason is that all the ones I saw in the local hardware stores either had handles that were really huge and badly designed or had a ridiculous number of heads, some that required extra storage. This has all you need for household use in a self-contained product. The fact that all metal parts of this tool are magnetized is an additional bonus. Glad I did the research and chose this one. This is a classic and would make a great gift for a new homeowner or young person building a supply of tools. I wish I'd had one 20 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: brinyside

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with the order but Amazon came up with a replacement. Great alternative for my Snap-On ratcheting screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Agulay

customer_reviews.title: Great ratchet screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: Great screwdriver I'm glad I bought it after looking into the brand
customer_reviews.author: Steven Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Great screwdriver. Very fine teeth on the ratcheting gears ...
customer_reviews.text: Great screwdriver. Very fine teeth on the ratcheting gears so it feels very smooth. Changing the direction of the ratchet is easy and I never have to struggle with it but at the same time it never gets hung up or changes direction while I'm using it (a problem on cheaper drivers). It's not bulky but it's shaped so you can still get a firm grip on it. I absolutely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAAT!
customer_reviews.text: If you want to spend $70 on the snap on name then be my guest. If you want to get a solid tools that literally contains the same bits as the snap and does the job EXACTLY the same way with as much precision then buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Kalisi & Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Great screwdriver. Basically Snap On at 1/3 of the price.
customer_reviews.author: A-aron

customer_reviews.title: WRST1
customer_reviews.text: We have both the Snap On and the JH Williams version of this ratcheting screwdriver. With a 100 piece hex bit set, this is worth its weight in gold if you use a lot of socket head cap screws like we do. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Vail Ave.

customer_reviews.title: I just wish it had knurled barrel like the snap-on one
customer_reviews.text: solid ratcheting scredriver. I just wish it had knurled barrel like the snap-on one. also wish it came in different colors.
customer_reviews.author: E.Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wrench
customer_reviews.text: You can keep the bits in the handle. Very practical
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopping Maven

customer_reviews.title: Best screwdriver I have ever owned. Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Best screwdriver I have ever owned. Recommended! Fine-toothed ratchet, good assortment of bits that I end up losing anyway. The black end cap is screw-on and the handle is hollow for bit storage, so it is possible to spill them.
customer_reviews.author: Art Buckler

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly good tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! Worth the money. The bits included are snap-on it doesn’t have the knurling as the snap on hard handle ratcheting screwdriver does, or the same handle shape, but otherwise it is the same quality. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty much the same tool for half the price of the snap on brand one. One of my favorite tools.
customer_reviews.author: Gk

customer_reviews.title: ratchet screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: works well and the ratchet is well made. fits hand good
customer_reviews.author: C. Legates

customer_reviews.title: Great screwdriver, best available at this price point!
customer_reviews.text: Same as the snap-on screwdriver. The blade is a little shorter, but no big deal. No knurling on the blade for grip either. I gave it a chemical test with typical aviation solvets and fluids and it passed with flying colors.You won't be disappointed! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is almost identical to the Snapon screw driver my dad had for many years, but much less expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, identical to my Snap On model. Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This screwdriver is exactly like the one that I bought from snap on 20 years ago for more than 2x the price this one is. The ratchet is very smooth, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He didn't have one that was magnetic and that was driving me crazy. Well...... unfortunately it never made it to his toolbox. It is kept in a kitchen drawer for easy access. It is always the first screwdriver to be grabbed. It is so smooth and easy to use. I would highly recommend this. I know it's higher in price than some, but well worth it. Every house needs at least two. I'll be ordering our second one for the hubby's toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: katybeth

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a lost 'tool truck' brand name screwdriver. This is just one of their other brands, less flashy, the same great quality, made in USA, and 1/3 of the price. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ondrea N Sneed

customer_reviews.title: nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Good workmanship and materials. fine ratchet. comfortable handle. made in usa
customer_reviews.author: iggy

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing I use it ever day at work
customer_reviews.author: alex avila

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny...
customer_reviews.text: This ratcheting screwdriver is the bomb. It's a replacement for a Home Supply Store special that fell apart under normal use. Looking at it, handling it, and using it for a few quick jobs I can already see that its construction warrants every penny I spent. It's a bit heavier, but if a little heavier weight means better construction, I don't mind that.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Good mobile screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: Good for around house don’t have to look for different ones
customer_reviews.author: randy

customer_reviews.title: price is great
customer_reviews.text: good price good tool and a lot cheaper than snap on
customer_reviews.author: victor hadden

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product! Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I'm an aircraft maintenance technician and some of my friends have snapon ratcheting screwdrivers and the quality is on par with snap-on! Would not expect anything less from Williams being a snap-on company. The ratcheting mechanism is exactly identical and the included bits will definitely prove to be a great addition to anybody who uses a product like this on a daily basis. The only difference I see between the snap-on alternative is the handle that provides more grip, however that isn't worth 30-35 dollars more. This does its job and more!
customer_reviews.author: Vickrum

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after talking two screw out
customer_reviews.text: I expected more out of Williams I had it less than two weeks and only used it a couple times the whole thing came apart I'll be sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Odin Randall

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a snap-on ratcheting screwdriver in black. I used it every day and love it! A regular ratcheting screwdriver still hurts my elbow but this one doesn't. And, I use different hex attachments to do nuts and bolts as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: First off this is a good ratcheting screwdriver made in the USA with USA made ...
customer_reviews.text: First off this is a good ratcheting screwdriver made in the USA with USA made bits. It gets 4 stars though because the 5 star is reserved for the best and that is the SO ratcheting screwdriver. I own both of these and can compare them side by side. The plastics on both are not something that will seem to be an issue either way. Both are strong. I am not a metallurgist and I have no way of telling which metal is better. The ratcheting mechanism on the SO though is much smoother and with finer teeth than the JH Williams. Bottom line is this is a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: sarah moulton

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with an extended Philips magnetic screwdriver, both are being used for building/repairing/modifying computers, the magnet is not strong enough to short out anything and is great companion
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Schobelock

customer_reviews.title: Snapon quality for less
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the same as the snapon except there’s no knurling on the shaft
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this tool and use it everyday on aircraft.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: love this tool
customer_reviews.text: worked beyond perfect for building up the PC i had just done. it was fantastic and worth every penny. now i want to get more accessories for the ratchet screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Eva cabral

customer_reviews.title: I like!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know Williams Tool was an actual division of Snap-On. Slightly bigger gap at collet and visible plastic mold seams. Ratcheting mechanism seems to be on par with my Snap-On version of the same thing. I like!
customer_reviews.author: Earl Whitmore Jr.

customer_reviews.title: As described by reviewers!!! Thanks
customer_reviews.text: I have had cause to use this unit while changing out a diaphragm on a valve in my sprinkler system. The length of the unit and the smooth gear operation were a dream to work with. Saved any stripping of the screw heads. As described the gear teeth action is as smooth or perhaps a bit smoother than my snap on driver.
customer_reviews.author: luvkosmo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Screw driver!
customer_reviews.text: This screwdriver is the absolute best replacement for the old Snap-On ratchet screw drive I had for so many years. Great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Ric

customer_reviews.title: Quality and durability built in
customer_reviews.text: great for working on motorcycles. just enough torque to get tight without snapping fasteners.
customer_reviews.author: ford63man

customer_reviews.title: Love it and love
customer_reviews.text: Found a similar item that is marketed for Brownells with their name on it that sells for a lot of money on their site. This one does the same thing and looks the same for a lot less money on Amazon. Love it and love Amazon
customer_reviews.author: mav207

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Smooth ratcheting action, feels very sturdy and hand and And has a deep hole in the bottom to hold a decent amount of bits.
customer_reviews.author: Trent B. Fabien

customer_reviews.title: Received broken screwdriver.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived defective. Ratcheting mechanism is completely broken and does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Snap-on brand ratcheting screwdriver for years and was convinced that theirs was by far the best. I was wrong. This one is every bit as good or better for a great price. If you've never owned one of these and you're considering buying one, your search has ended. This is the one you need. Fantastic product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: blakes68

customer_reviews.title: You found it! Your next and last ratchet screwdriver.
customer_reviews.text: My "go-to" screwdriver for all purposes. Best ratchet mechanism available, JH Williams tough from the producer of Snap-On but without the higher price. Bonus: Best spare bit storage, out of the way, secure, and accessible. Stop looking. Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic Ratcheting Screwdriver is in the title, and that is what you get
customer_reviews.text: I use it for opening wood crates, computer chassis and anything else that needs a screw driver. Magnet is good quality, holds the screws in place nice and snug. Nice forearm workout too, if you use it enough!
customer_reviews.author: Croft IT

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.text: A 1/3 of the price I paid for my original Snap On screwdriver 20 years ago, & it works just as well. Definitely recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: Solid ratcheting screwdriver made in the U.S.A.
customer_reviews.text: Should have used this sooner. The same thing as snap-on but in black. This is as solid as they get as far as ratcheting screwdriver. Another awesome tool made in the U.S.A.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

product_meta.title: Williams WRS-1 Magnetic Ratcheting Screwdriver
product_meta.description:
Size:9-inch| Style:Normal-HandleErgonomically designed handle for greater user comfort and control Hi-impact plastic handle for durability and flexibility in all types of work applications Heavy-duty 3-way On-Off-Locked ratcheting mechanism allows consistent and smooth operation Powerful magnetic shank securely holds bit in place before, during and after the job application Stainless steel shank eliminates problems of chrome chipping or rust Easy bit storage in handle.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Snap-on Industrial Brand JH Williams magnetic ratcheting screwdriver is 9-Inch in length and has a blade length of 4-Inch. 5 bits are included: 2 slotted, 2 Phillips, and 1 Torx. The handle is ergonomically designed for greater user comfort and control. The hi impact plastic handle for durability and flexibility in all types of work applications. The heavy duty 3 way on off locked ratcheting mechanism allows consistent and smooth operation. The powerful magnetic shank securely holds bit in place before, during and after the job application. The stainless steel shank eliminates problems of chrome chipping or rust. There is easy bit storage in handle and accepts all standard 1/4-Inch hex shank bits.
feature_bullets: Ergonomically designed handle for greater user comfort and control
Heavy duty 3 way on off locked ratcheting mechanism allows consistent and smooth operation
Powerful magnetic shank securely holds bit in place before, during, after the job application
